    • Uses of Beta in squidpony.annotation

      Classes in squidpony.annotation with annotations of type Beta 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      interface  Beta
      Signifies that a public API (public class, method or field) is subject to incompatible changes, or even removal, in a future release.

    • Uses of Beta in squidpony.bootstrap

      Classes in squidpony.bootstrap with annotations of type Beta 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BootStrapFrame
      Builds, manages, and displays a JFrame with a SwingPane in it allowing for a minimal-effort construction of a GUI for use with SquidLib.
      interface  GameLogic
      This interface indicates the ability to perform the game logic associated with GUI input.

    • Uses of Beta in squidpony.squidgrid.fov

      Classes in squidpony.squidgrid.fov with annotations of type Beta 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BresenhamFOV
      Uses BresenhamLOS to run lines out to the edges.
      class  EliasFOV
      Uses the Elias line running to raycast.
      interface  FOVCell
      A cell which contains the information needed to process FOV and LOS.
      class  MergedFOV
      This class merges the results from two or more FOVSolvers.
      class  RayCastingFOV
      Simple raytracing algorithm for Field of View.
      class  RippleFOV
      Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
      class  SpreadFOV
      Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
      interface  ThinWallFOVSolver
      Interface for FOVSolvers which can work with thin walls.
      class  ThreadedFOVSolver
      A threaded wrapper for an FOVSolver.

      A 2D Field of View solver that understands cells having edges and will return lighting based on them.

    • Uses of Beta in squidpony.squidtext

      Classes in squidpony.squidtext with annotations of type Beta 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DamerauLevenshteinAlgorithm
      The Damerau-Levenshtein Algorithm is an extension to the Levenshtein Algorithm which solves the edit distance problem between a source string and a target string with the following operations: Character Insertion Character Deletion Character Replacement Adjacent Character Swap Note that the adjacent character swap operation is an edit that may be applied when two adjacent characters in the source string match two adjacent characters in the target string, but in reverse order, rather than a general allowance for adjacent character swaps.
      class  StringUtils
      Based on work by Nolithius available at the following two sites https://github.com/Nolithius/weighted-letter-namegen http://code.google.com/p/weighted-letter-namegen/

    • Uses of Beta in squidpony.squidtext.nolithiusgen
